meanings.definition: In a manner showing lack of trust or confidence.
meanings.sent1: She looked at him mistrustfully, unsure of his intentions.
meanings.sent2: He glanced mistrustfully at the stranger approaching.
meanings.sent3: The cat eyed the new dog mistrustfully, wondering if it would steal its toys.
meanings.sent4: The old house creaked mistrustfully, as if wary of the new owners.
meanings.sent5: The dark clouds gathered mistrustfully, hinting at an impending storm.

meanings.sent1: The detective observed the suspect mistrustfully, trying to catch any lies.
meanings.sent2: She listened mistrustfully to the unbelievable story.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel eyed the acorn mistrustfully, as if suspecting a trick.
meanings.sent4: The river flowed mistrustfully around the sharp rocks, as if fearing to be diverted.
meanings.sent5: The wind howled mistrustfully through the empty streets, carrying whispers of secrets.
